name: Mahatma Gandhi
details: Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi was an Indian lawyer, anti-colonial nationalist and political ethicist, who employed nonviolent resistance to lead the successful campaign for India's independence from British rule.

name: B. R. Ambedkar
details: Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar was an Indian jurist, economist, social reformer, and the principal architect of the Constitution of India. He campaigned against social discrimination towards the untouchables and played a key role in shaping independent India's policies on social justice.

name: Jawaharlal Nehru
details: Jawaharlal Nehru was the first Prime Minister of India and a central figure in Indian politics before and after independence.

name: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel
details: Vallabhbhai Patel, a senior leader of the Indian National Congress, was a key figure in the country's struggle for independence and its integration into a united, independent nation.

name: Subhas Chandra Bose
details: Subhas Chandra Bose was an Indian nationalist whose defiant patriotism made him a hero in India. He led the Indian National Army against British rule during World War II.

name: Bhagat Singh
details: An Indian socialist revolutionary whose acts of dramatic violence against the British and execution at age 23 made him a folk hero of the Indian independence movement.

name: Sukhdev Thapar
details: Sukhdev Thapar was an Indian revolutionary who, along with Bhagat Singh and Rajguru, was involved in the assassination of British police officer J. P. Saunders. He was executed by hanging at the age of 23.

name: Shivaram Rajguru
details: Shivaram Rajguru was an Indian revolutionary from Maharashtra, known for his involvement in the assassination of British officer J.P. Saunders.

name: Rani Lakshmibai
details: Rani Lakshmibai was a leading figure of the Indian Rebellion of 1857, known for her bravery and leadership in fighting against British forces.

name: Bal Gangadhar Tilak
details: Bal Gangadhar Tilak was a nationalist, teacher, and independence activist, often called 'The father of Indian unrest' for his strong demand for self-rule.

name: Chandra Shekhar Azad
details: Chandra Shekhar Azad was a revolutionary leader in the Indian independence struggle, who vowed never to be captured alive by the British.

name: Lala Lajpat Rai
details: Lala Lajpat Rai was a prominent nationalist leader and part of the Lal-Bal-Pal trio, known for his role in protests against British rule.

name: Mangal Pandey
details: Mangal Pandey was an Indian soldier who played a key role in sparking the Indian Rebellion of 1857.

name: Annie Besant
details: Annie Besant was a British socialist, theosophist, and supporter of Indian self-rule, who helped found the Home Rule League.

name: Bipin Chandra Pal
details: Bipin Chandra Pal was an Indian nationalist, one of the Lal-Bal-Pal trio, and a key figure in promoting radical approaches to independence.

name: Dadabhai Naoroji
details: Dadabhai Naoroji was a founding member of the Indian National Congress and the first Asian to sit in the British Parliament.

name: Vinayak Damodar Savarkar
details: Savarkar was a freedom fighter, social reformer, and the formulator of the Hindutva philosophy.

name: Rajendra Prasad
details: Rajendra Prasad was an Indian independence activist, lawyer, scholar, and the first President of India.

name: Maulana Abul Kalam Azad
details: Azad was a senior leader of the Indian National Congress and a prominent freedom fighter, scholar, and the first Minister of Education.

name: Gopal Krishna Gokhale
details: Gokhale was a senior leader of the Indian National Congress and a mentor to Mahatma Gandhi.

name: Aruna Asaf Ali
nickname: Grand Old Lady of the Independence Movement
details: Aruna Asaf Ali was a political leader and freedom fighter known for hoisting the Indian National Congress flag at the Gowalia Tank Maidan during the Quit India Movement.

name: Sarojini Naidu
details: Sarojini Naidu was a poet, politician, and activist, who became the first woman to become the president of the Indian National Congress.

name: Tantia Tope
details: Tantia Tope was a general in the Indian Rebellion of 1857 and one of its most notable leaders.

name: Ashfaqulla Khan
details: Ashfaqulla Khan was an Indian freedom fighter involved in the Kakori Train Robbery of 1925.

name: Kanaklata Barua
details: Kanaklata Barua was a teenage freedom fighter from Assam who died during the Quit India Movement.

name: Matangini Hazra
details: Matangini Hazra was a freedom fighter from West Bengal who was shot dead by the British police during a protest.

name: Alluri Sitarama Raju
details: Alluri Sitarama Raju was an Indian revolutionary who led the Rampa Rebellion against the British in Andhra Pradesh.

name: Udham Singh
details: Udham Singh was a revolutionary known for assassinating Michael O'Dwyer to avenge the Jallianwala Bagh massacre.

name: Batukeshwar Dutt
details: Batukeshwar Dutt was an Indian revolutionary who, along with Bhagat Singh, exploded bombs in the Central Legislative Assembly in Delhi.

name: Ram Prasad Bismil
details: Ram Prasad Bismil was a poet and revolutionary who participated in the Mainpuri Conspiracy of 1918 and the Kakori Conspiracy of 1925.

name: Bhikaji Cama
details: Bhikaji Cama was an Indian independence activist who unfurled the first version of the Indian national flag on foreign soil.

name: K. M. Munshi
details: K. M. Munshi was an Indian independence movement activist, politician, writer, and educationist from Gujarat.

name: V. O. Chidambaram Pillai
details: Chidambaram Pillai was a freedom fighter and founder of the first indigenous Indian shipping service.

name: Peer Ali Khan
details: Peer Ali Khan was a revolutionary during India's First War of Independence and one of the first martyrs of the movement.

name: Gulzarilal Nanda
details: Gulzarilal Nanda served as the Acting Prime Minister of India twice, in 1964 and 1966.

name: Velu Nachiyar
details: Velu Nachiyar was an Indian queen and the first female freedom fighter who fought against British colonial rule.

name: Lal Bahadur Shastri
details: Lal Bahadur Shastri promoted the White Revolution and gave the slogan 'Jai Jawan Jai Kisan'.

name: Indira Gandhi
details: Indira Gandhi was the first and only female Prime Minister of India, serving from 1966–1977 and 1980–1984.

name: Morarji Desai
details: Morarji Desai was the first Prime Minister to lead a non-Congress government in India.

name: Charan Singh
details: Charan Singh was known for his pro-farmer policies and served as the 5th Prime Minister of India.

name: Rajiv Gandhi
details: Rajiv Gandhi modernized India’s telecom sector and initiated computerization.

name: Vishwanath Pratap Singh
details: V. P. Singh was known for implementing the Mandal Commission report on reservation.

name: Chandra Shekhar
details: Chandra Shekhar served as Prime Minister from 1990 to 1991 and was known for his socialist principles.

name: P. V. Narasimha Rao
details: P. V. Narasimha Rao led major economic reforms and liberalization in the 1990s.

name: Atal Bihari Vajpayee
details: Atal Bihari Vajpayee served three terms as Prime Minister and was known for his oratory skills and economic reforms.

name: H. D. Deve Gowda
details: H. D. Deve Gowda served as the 11th Prime Minister of India from 1996 to 1997.

name: I. K. Gujral
details: I. K. Gujral promoted friendly relations with India's neighbors during his term as Prime Minister.

name: Manmohan Singh
details: Manmohan Singh served as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014 and is credited with key economic reforms.
